Description:
V. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor of Engineering degree in Electrical Engineering
Minimum of 10 years of experience in electrical construction management, with a focus on high voltage 380kv Substations, Overhead Transmission lines and underground cable systems
Experience working in Saudi Arabia with the Saudi Electric Supply Company is a plus.
Experience working on projects involving overhead transmission lines in hilly terrain is a plus.
Experience in project management, including managing budgets and schedules.
Strong leadership and Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with team members, contractors, and clients.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and project management software
Bachelorâ€™s degree in electrical engineering
Strong understanding of electrical engineering principles and high voltage electrical systems
Experience managing projects from concept to completion, including project planning, budgeting, and resource management.
Ability to identify and mitigate project risks and issues.
Strong leadership and mentorship skills, with a focus on developing and motivating team members to achieve project objectives.
Risk Management, change management and Interface Management:
Experience in identifying, mitigating, and managing project risks to minimize project delays, costs, and safety hazards.
Problem Solving: Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot issues and make effective decisions to ensure successful project delivery.
Experience in working with other disciplines such as Civil/ Structural and Environmental Engineers to design electrical installation.
Experience of managing stakeholders of the project (Contractor/Client/Govt. Entities)
Knowledge on HS&E & Quality procedures, Knowledge of health, safety, and environmental regulations and requirements
